topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Monitor Disk Drive(s)

body.p: The Icinga service, which runs in the undercloud, helps cloud admins monitor the health of the disk drive(s) of all the swift node(s).

ul.li:
HPE Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.
(Starter Object Storage (Swift) nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment)
The Icinga service is active and running in the undercloud.
hpssacli utility must be downloaded and installed. To download and install, refer hpssacli utility.

section.title: Monitoring the Disk Drive(s) of Swift
section.p: It is important to check the health of the disk drive of Swift cluster on timely basis. To monitor the disk drives on Swift nodes using Icinga, hpssacli utility must be installed in all Swift node(s).
Perform the following steps to monitor the status of the disk drive:

ol.li:
In the undercloud Horizon dashboard, log in to the Icinga Dashboard (http://<Undercloud_IP>/icinga/). The default login credentials are as follows:
Username: icingaadmin
Password: icingaadmin

Click Status on the left panel and click Host Details.
The page navigates to the Host Status Details for all Hosts.

In the Host column, click the icon next to the host IP when the tooltip displays as "View Service Details For This Host". The page navigates to Service Status Details For Host <Swift node IP address > and displays the status of the disk drive(s) of the selected Swift node.

row.entry: Drive diagnostic completed: No errors found.
This message appears on Proxy servers where there are no account, container or object servers configured. This is a normal status.
